title.narrative: Care for victims of sexual violence

description.narrative: The proposed project aims to provide support for 2 years in the health system of the province of North Kivu in its effort to strengthen the medical and psychosocial care for victims of sexual violence. A population of 1,267,333 inhabitants in 4 health zones will be targeted by this support. Long characterized by ongoing insecurity, the North Kivu province has seen some improvement in the security situation following the victory in 2013 of the armed forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo on the main rebel movement called M23. However, the security situation begins again to deteriorate in late 2014, and some areas of insecurity persist. As a result,sexual violence remains a serious public health problem. The areas where the conflict persists are particularly affected and authors are in those areas attributed to armed groups. sexual violence survivors have very limited access to health services, basic socio-economic and legal. The project objective is to improve the accessibility, availability and quality of medical and psychosocial carefor victims of sexual violence (VVS) in Kirotshe health zones, Goma, Karisimbi and Nyiragongo located in the North Kivu province bystrengthening the health system.

participating-org.narrative: LOFEPACO (Congolese League of Women Farmers' Organisations) is a network that unites eleven agricultural producers' organisations in the province of North Kivu in the east of the Democratic Republic Congo. LOFEPACO was founded in 2000 with the objectiveto promoterural women, specifically women agricultural producers. LOFEPACO is a platform where women's organisations can exchange experiencesand unite their forces. Most member organisations of LOFEPACO are also member of the FOPAC network of agricultural producers organisations. However it was decided to create LOFEPACO because women's interests are/were not sufficiently defended in the general farmers' movements. LOFEPACO works specifically on the promotion and defence of women's interests and rights, by working on food and income security (production, processing and marketing), women's leadership, organisation building, and promoting women's interests through lobby and advocacy. LOFEPACO started working in the north of North Kivu (Beni Butembo) with AGRITERRA and Vredeseilanden. In 2008LOFEPACO responded to Oxfam Novib's call for proposals for livelihood projects. A first partnership started when the three-year program was approved. It aims at establishing LOFEPACO and its work in Walikale, Masisi and Ruthshuru. LOFEPACO, created in June 2000, is platform of 17 Congolese women's organizations composed mainly of agricultural producers. LOFEPACO support women, notably in sectors of food security and prevention campaigns of gender-based violence. LOFEPACO is partners of ONL since 6 years in We can campaign. As part of this project, LOFEPACO has implemented an awareness campaign against violence against women and sexual violence throughits community outreach and media such as radio and television. They are working together with other NGOs such as AGRITERRA, OXFAM SOLIDARITE, VECO, ICCO, IFDC and EAFF.
Ligue des Organisations des Femmes Paysannes du Congo
